node.description: Calls for Boris Johnson to resign.
node.content: ["Boris Johnson, the British prime minister, is under growing pressure to resign after a public backlash over a Downing Street garden party he attended last year while his country was under a strict coronavirus lockdown. Johnson, who had not previously admitted to being at the event, offered a contrite apology to fellow Britons during Prime Minister\u2019s Questions yesterday.", "\u201cI want to apologize,\u201d he said. \u201cI know the rage they feel with me and with the government I lead, when they think in Downing Street itself the rules are not being properly followed by the people who make the rules.\u201d He insisted that he had thought the gathering was a work event that did not breach government regulations \u2014 a claim that provoked incredulity among critics.", "Top officials of the opposition Labour Party were scathing as they called for his resignation. \u201cThe party is over, prime minister,\u201d Labour\u2019s leader, Keir Starmer, declared. \u201cThe only question is: \u2018Will the British public kick him out? Will his party kick him out? Or will he do the decent thing and resign?\u2019\u201d Conservative backbenchers now fear a public backlash, and an internal investigation is ongoing.", "Backlash: Roger Gale, a Conservative lawmaker and a vocal critic of Johnson\u2019s, told the BBC that the prime minister had misled Parliament and was \u201cpolitically a dead man walking.\u201d The leader of the Scottish Conservatives, Douglas Ross, also called on Johnson to stand aside.", "China\u2019s \u201czero Covid\u201d policy, which involves efforts to eliminate the virus from the country altogether, is carried out by millions of people who work diligently toward that goal, even at the expense of people\u2019s lives, well-being and dignity.", "China\u2019s early authoritarian policies to combat the coronavirus seem to have emboldened officials. Many now believe that they must do everything within their power to ensure zero Covid infections, since it is the will of their top leader, Xi Jinping. In some cases, their actions have had tragic consequences, with people being denied health care or being beaten for seeking food.", "These tensions play out online, as zealous nationalists spar with Chinese citizens who question how those enforcing the quarantine rules can behave in such a manner and ask who holds ultimate responsibility. Some have invoked the phrase \u201cthe banality of evil\u201d in the discussions, an expression coined by the philosopher Hannah Arendt in her writings on the Holocaust.", "Xi\u2019an: A strict lockdown in the northwestern Chinese city that began in December created chaos and crisis after the local government opted not to provide food, medical care and other necessities to the city\u2019s 13 million residents.", "Olympics: The Winter Olympics are just three weeks away, but tickets have yet to go on sale. It will be the most extraordinarily restricted large sporting event since the start of the pandemic.", "Here are the latest updates and maps of the pandemic.", "In other developments:", "Kevin McCarthy, the House minority leader, has refused to cooperate with a formal request for an interview with the select committee scrutinizing the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. On the day itself, McCarthy was in close contact with Donald Trump before, during and after the violence. He has fought to shut down any investigation of the events.", "The request sent a clear message that the committee\u2019s investigators are willing to pursue the highest-ranking figures on Capitol Hill for information about the former president\u2019s mind-set as the violence unfolded. McCarthy, a California Republican, is on track to become the speaker of the House if Republicans retake the chamber in November.", "In a statement, McCarthy condemned the investigation as \u201cillegitimate.\u201d He has led his party\u2019s opposition to the formation of a bipartisan panel as initially conceived to investigate the riot, has opposed the creation of the current committee and has attacked the panel\u2019s work for weeks.", "Grounds: Bennie Thompson, the chairman of the committee, said the panel had obtained \u201ccontemporaneous text messages from multiple witnesses\u201d that refer to White House staff members as expressing \u201csignificant concerns\u201d about Trump\u2019s \u201cstate of mind and his ongoing conduct\u201d in the days after Jan. 6.", "For people over 70, sex can drop off, even in relationships that are otherwise warm and high functioning. But for those who keep going, it can be the best of their lives.", "Ronnie Spector, the lead singer of the 1960s pop group the Ronettes on hits like \u201cBe My Baby,\u201d has died at 78.", "\u201cDon\u2019t Look Up\u201d is one of Netflix\u2019s most popular films ever. After it premiered in December, climate scientists took to social media and penned opinion essays, saying they felt seen at last.", "In the movie, a planet-killing comet serves as a metaphor for the climate crisis. A team of scientists, frantically pushing for government action but ignored because of politics, profiteering and apathy, stands in for climate scientists who are pushing for cuts to emissions.", "Adam McKay, the director, wants the film to be \u201ca kick in the pants\u201d that prompts urgent climate action. Netflix worked with climate scientists to share ways to take action, and cast members have pointed to climate legislation voters can support.", "\u201cI\u2019m under no illusions that one film will be the cure to the climate crisis,\u201d McKay, whose previous films include \u201cThe Big Short\u201d and \u201cVice,\u201d told The Times. \u201cBut if it inspires conversation, critical thinking, and makes people less tolerant of inaction from their leaders, then I\u2019d say we accomplished our goal.\u201d", "This quick-braised chicken with greens gets its bite from hot pickled peppers and their brine.", "Melatonin isn\u2019t a sleeping pill. Here\u2019s how to use it.", "\u201cParallel Mothers,\u201d the seventh film by Pedro Almod\u00f3var that stars Pen\u00e9lope Cruz, is one of their greatest together. Cruz says making the film was the hardest thing she had ever done.", "Here\u2019s today\u2019s Mini Crossword, and a clue: What mosquitoes and vampires do (four letters).", "And here is the Spelling Bee.", "You can find all our puzzles here.", "That\u2019s it for today\u2019s briefing. Thanks for joining me. \u2014 Natasha", "P.S. The Newswomen\u2019s Club of New York gave a Times Op-Ed columnist, Gail Collins, its lifetime achievement award.", "The latest episode of \u201cThe Daily\u201d is about Russia and Ukraine.", "Melina Delkic wrote today\u2019s Arts and Ideas. You can reach Natasha and the team at briefing@nytimes.com."]
